Name: acknowledgement
Value: IOS Mooring Group; Roy Hourston, for metadata gathering and data processing; Emily Chisholm, for supplying the R script that performed the processing and netCDF file output.
Definition: An acknowledgement of teams or individuals who have helped with the data set

Name: agency
Value: IOS, Ocean Sciences Division, Sidney, B.C.
Definition: The organization through which data collection and processing were conducted, reads 'DFO' then the organization acronym

Name: anchor_type
Definition: The type of anchor used

Name: anchor_drop_time
Definition: The date and time (format YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss UTC) at which the anchor was dropped

Name: anchor_release_time
Definition: The date and time (format YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss UTC) at which the anchor was released

Name: comment
Value: Archived raw .000 files were used to make this data set.
Definition: A comment on the data set, processing or otherwise

Name: country
Definition: The country of the agency

Name: country_institute_code
Definition: The code number for the institute found at https://www.nodc.noaa.gov/General/NODC-Archive/institutionlist.txt

Name: cruise_description
Value: The deployment cruise was taken on the John P. Tully. The recovery cruise was taken on the John P. Tully in deteriorating conditions and approaching dark. The external battery pack of the ADCP flooded. Five out of eight of the ADCP's trawl floats flooded. The Vemco's caused many tangles and proved dangerous when working in marginal conditions offshore.
Definition: A description of the recovery and deployment missions

Name: cut_lead_ensembles
Definition: The number of leading ensembles to cut from the dataset

Name: cut_trail_ensembles
Definition: The number of trailing ensembles to cut from the dataset

Name: deployment_cruise_number
Definition: The number of the deployment cruise

Name: geographic_area
Definition: Geographic area of the station

Name: history
Value: The metadata were extracted from the corresponding processed .adcp file provided by Roy Hourston. The data were extracted from the raw ADCP binary file using an R routine provided by Emily Chisholm. Instrument depth was derived from reconciling all trustworthy pressure sensors on the mooring (i.e., Sea-Bird) and the mooring line length.
Definition: The history of the processing and data set

Name: instrument_depth
Definition: Depth of the instrument in meters

Name: latitude
Definition: Latitude of mooring in decimal degrees

Name: longitude
Definition: Longitude of mooring in decimal degrees

Name: platform
Definition: The platform/ship name

Name: project
Definition: The project under which data were collected

Name: publisher_email
Definition: The email of the data shop which published and processed this data set

Name: return_cruise_number
Definition: The number of the return cruise

Name: scientist
Definition: The chief scientist of the project (last name first initial)

Name: sea_code
Definition: The NODC code corresponding to the sea the station is in from NOAA at https://www.nodc.noaa.gov/General/NODC-Archive/seanamelist.txt

Name: sea_name
Definition: From the list of sea names provided by NOAA at https://www.nodc.noaa.gov/General/NODC-Archive/seanamelist.txt

Name: station
Definition: The station name for the mooring

Name: deployment_number
Definition: The deployment number (used to follow a lettering scheme)

Name: water_depth
Definition: Water depth in meters

Name: instrumentSubtype
Definition: The instrument subtype

Name: serialNumber
Definition: The serial number of the instrument

Name: magnetic_variation
Definition: The average magnetic variation of the timeseries
